qas.question: In what century did a new kind of red pigment arrive in Europe from the Aztec Empire?
Which conquistador from Spain conquered the Aztec Empire?
During what years was the Aztec Empire conquered?
How often could the Mexican cochineal be harvested?
In what year did Cortes send the first cochineal to Spain?
What Aztec conquistador conquered the Spanish Empire?

plausible_answers.text: Spanish conquistador Hernán Cortés and his soldiers conquered the Aztec Empire

qas.question: Who conquered the Spanish Empire in 1519-1521?
Who sent the first shipment to Spain in 1532?

plausible_answers.text: Cortes sent the first shipment to Spain.

context: But early in the <a0_0>16th<a0_0/> century, a brilliant new red appeared in Europe. When the <b6_0>Spanish conquistador <a1_0><b5_0><b7_0>Hernán Cortés<b7_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> and his soldiers conquered the Aztec Empire<b6_0/> in <a2_0>1519-1521<a2_0/>, they discovered slowly that the Aztecs had another treasure beside silver and gold; they had the tiny cochineal, a parasitic scale insect which lived on cactus plants, which, when dried and crushed, made a magnificent red. The cochineal in Mexico was closely related to the Kermes varieties of Europe, but unlike European Kermes, it could be harvested <a3_0>several times a year<a3_0/>, and it was ten times stronger than the Kermes of Poland. It worked particularly well on silk, satin and other luxury textiles. In <a4_0>1523<a4_0/> <b8_0><b9_0>Cortes<b8_0/> sent the first shipment to Spain.<b9_0/> Soon cochineal began to arrive in European ports aboard convoys of Spanish galleons.
